direction.raw_text: dissolves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .EXT. 112 OCEAN AVENUE  AMITYVILLE  NIGHT We slowly pan through a suburban neighbourhood located on the south shore of Long Island. The still shroud of night blankets the village of Amityville in the early morning hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Appears: Thursday, November 14, 1974.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dissolves. Stray house pets are the only signs of life as families and neighbours slumber. We reach 112 Ocean Avenue, a large Dutch Colonial house. The home is a classic piece of Americana, two stories plus an attic, several rooms, and a boathouse on the Amityville River. There are quarter round windows on the top floor that give the appearance of eyes staring back at us. A signpost in the front yard reads "HIGH HOPES", a testament to what the home symbolizes for the family that live there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. BASEMENT  112 OCEAN AVENUE  CONTINUOUS We move slowly through the basement, past various crushed beer cans and a table full of drug paraphernalia, until we reach a bearded man in his early twenties. RONALD DEFEO JUNIOR, known to his family and friends as BUTCH. He sits on a ragged sofa, dozing off in front of a small Television that displays white static. There is a digital clock on a small table by the side of the sofa. It reads 3:14am. We hold on the clock and the time changes to 3:15am. We can see DeFeo's breath drift from his
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . lips as cold air sweeps through the room. His eyes snap open. A hooded figure, face shrouded in darkness, steps from the shadows. The figure carries a .35 caliber lever action Marlin 336C rifle. Hands clad in black leather gloves, the mysterious person holds the rifle out in front of Butch. A voice emerges from beneath the hood that is so deep as to be
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill them. Kill them all. Butch stands and takes the rifle. The figure retreats back into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  CONTINUOUS The house is silent. Butch quietly stalks the hallways, the rifle grasped tightly in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. MASTER BEDROOM  CONTINUOUS Butch quietly pushes the door aside and observes his parents as they sleep. RONALD DEFEO SENIOR, age forty three, is a heavy set Italian American man and his wife LOUISE DEFEO is a slender woman, aged forty two, with flowing blonde hair. Both are lying flat on their stomachs. Without hesitation, Butch raises the rifle to his shoulder and pulls the trigger. The BLAST is deafening. The first shot rips into his fathers back, tearing through his kidney and exiting through his chest. Butch fires another round, again hitting his father in the back. This shot pierces the base of Ronald Senior's spine, and lodges in his neck.Louise DeFeo's eyes open, but she barely has a few seconds to react. Butch aims the weapon at his mother as she lays prone on the bed, and fires two shots in quick succession. The bullets shatter her rib cage and collapse her right lung. Both bodies now lay silently in fresh pools of their own blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  CONTINUOUS 4 Butch, in an almost trance like state, walks down the hall and quietly nudges the door to another bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. BOY'S BEDROOM  CONTINUOUS Butch enters the bedroom that his two brothers MARK, aged twelve, and JOHN, aged nine, share. He walks between their two beds as they lie on their stomachs, sleeping soundly. Standing directly above his two helpless brothers, Butch fires one shot into each of the boys as they lay sleeping. The bullets tear through their young bodies, ravaging their internal organs, laying waste to the lives that lay ahead of them. Mark lays motionless, while John, whose spinal cord has been severed by his brother's heartless attack, twitches spasmodically for a few moments after the shooting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  CONTINUOUS Stangely, the loud shots have not roused the remaining members of the DeFeo family, and Butch skulks unchallenged to his final destination-the bedroom shared by his sisters
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eighteen years old, and ALLISON, aged thirteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. GIRLS' BEDROOM  CONTINUOUS As Butch enters the room, Allison stirs. She looks up just as Butch lowers the rifle to her face and pulls the trigger. Butch then aims his weapon at Dawn's head and squeezes the trigger again, literally blowing the left side of her face off. Both girls die instantly. The white sheets and walls are splattered with blood and brain matter. Butch is unmoved and expressionless. He surveys the carnage for a moment, then calmly walks out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  CONTINUOUS 5. Butch walks past a photograph hanging on the wall in a red frame. It shows all seven members of the DeFeo family in a group, hugging each other with smiles on their faces. The sound of children singing the nursery rhyme "Ring Around a Rosie" in a slow, haunting manner echoes through the house. We push in on the photograph and:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .EXT. CAR  AMITYVILLE  DAY A car drives through the village of Amityville on a cold winter's day. TITLE CARD appears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dissolves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. CAR  CONTINUOUS A young girl in her mid twenties is driving the car. She is attractive yet she dresses very conservatively in a thick sweater and baggy combat trousers. This is LISA TEMPLETON. She consults a crumpled piece of paper. Directions are scribbled on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .EXT. CAR  CONTINUOUS The car turns the corner and heads down a long driveway surrounded by trees. The car approaches a large imposing building which casts a dark shadow over the grounds. Outside a sign reads HIGH HOPES HOSPITAL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  HIGH HOPES HOSPITAL  DAY 6 Lisa is sat on a bench in a long empty corridor. She has a file in her hand and taps her fingers on it nervously. A door opens and a middle aged man dressed in a crisp white shirt and tie steps out. He is well groomed and his eyes are warm and inviting. This is DOCTOR ELLIOT MIXTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa Templeton? Lisa stands abruptly, dropping her file in the process.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me! Sorry- Lisa scrambles to pick up the file and papers fall out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit! Mixter smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to say that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's quite alright. I'm Doctor Elliot Mixter. Come into my office. Lisa manages to retrieve the file and papers from the floor and compose herself. Mixter holds the door open and Lisa enters the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. MIXTER'S OFFICE  CONTINUOUS Lisa stands in the office. Mixter enters and shuts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, take a seat. Lisa sinks into a chair next to a large oak desk. Mixter walks to the opposite side and sits in a large leather chair facing her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've uh... brought my resume and some references. I know I already sent a copy with my application but just in case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Mixter takes the file from her and opens it on his desk. He glances over it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good. I see you've had lots of experience cleaning private homes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I uh... I've done a lot of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well an institution such as this one is a very different proposition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes. Yes I know. You'll see I've also worked cleaning a school, so I am used to big areas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes I've seen that. When I say this is a different proposition I mean in terms of the sensitivity required due to the nature of what we do here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes, yes of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You would mainly be working night shifts at a time when patients are on lock down. But many of our patients here have psychological disturbances so there may be situations where you have to clean up things you may not be used to cleaning up. If you know what I'm saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what you mean, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would that bother you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It may be strange at first but I actually have some experience in 8 that area. I would clean my mother when she lost control of her bodily functions during her illness. It's something I got used to very quickly. It became routine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. How is your mother now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... she passed away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry to hear that. So... it's important to me that every employee here, whether they are a psychiatrist, an orderly or a cleaner, needs to fully understand what our mission statement at this hospital is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: High Hopes was only built two years ago and as an institution we have only been running for just over a year now. So we're still building our reputation. But I am very clear on what I want that reputation to be. I intend to make this institution one of the foremost centres for mental health treatment in the country. If you look into my history you'll know that I have a stellar reputation in the field of psychiatry and I want to use that to help others. That is why I have put my own money into the creation of this institution. We are only just starting out but we have a long term ambition to be considered the best. So what I require is that every person who works at this institution, in any capacity, must be professional and sensitive to the needs of the patients. Unlike other institutions, the welfare and care of our patients comes first here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really admire that and I promise I would not let you down if I was given this job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure you wouldn't. Lisa's face quickly contorts. Mixter looks puzzled. Suddenly Lisa sneezes. It shoots out so rapidly she has no time to cover her mouth and nose. She sneezes all over Mixter. Lisa looks horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God, I'm so sorry!! Lisa rushes to Mixter's side and grabs a tissue from a Kleenex box on his desk. She frantically wipes the saliva and snot from his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's quite alright, please sit down, I can take care of it. Lisa, completely mortified, sits back down. An unimpressed Mixter wipes the spittle off his face with a tissue. When he's done he stares at Lisa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... well thanks for coming in. I'll let you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look I'm so sorry, I really am!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine. We'll be in touch. Such is her embarrassment, Lisa can't get out of the office fast enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. BEDROOM  LISA'S HOME - LONG ISLAND  NIGHT Lisa is lying on her bed watching TV, flicking endlessly through the channels. The phone on the bedside table rings. Lisa picks up the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Hey hun!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Nancy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) How did it go today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a total fucking disaster!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Oh I'm sure you're just being silly hun! Whenever I've gone for an interview I always come out thinking it's gone really badly. But I bet it went better than you think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sneezed on the head of the institution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) You what??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sneezed on him! It was one of those sneezes that just sneaks up on you, I didn't have time to cover my face. Before you know it he's covered in my snot!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Oh God I'm sorry hun. Long silence on the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on, go ahead. You know you want to!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) [HYSTERIAL LAUGHTER]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laugh it up, it's gonna be your last chance because I'm not going for any more job interviews! I'm done, I'm always so damn nervous and I just don't make a good first impression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) You should take my advice and show a little cleavage at these interviews! Trust me, you'd get the job then!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's just not me Nance. I wouldn't know where to start with flirting or any of that. Christ, if I wore high heels to one of these interviews I'd probably trip over! I'm a clumsy dork!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) So what are you thinking of doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno. Thanks for not disputing that dork remark by the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) [Laughs] Sorry, hun!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I'll have to sign on welfare to make the rent. Long term, maybe I should go back to school. Get better qualified for something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) How come you don't do something with your writing? You could try and get something published. Or write a book or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno, I just... it's like I just haven't been able to bring myself to write since ... you know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) I know. It's a cliche, but time really is a healer. I'm sure the passion you had for it will come back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) You wanna talk about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not really. I just think I'm gonna get myself a nice big tub of ice cream from the freezer and watch some TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Comfort eating!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [Smiles] I know but if there's ever a good time for ice cream it's today!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Can't argue with that! Give me a call tomorrow, let's go for coffee soon yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. KITCHEN  LISA'S HOME  LATER Lisa is rummaging in her freezer for some ice cream. She pulls out a tub and tosses it on the counter. She opens the cutlery drawer and grabs a spoon. The phone rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. LIVING ROOM  CONTINUOUS Lisa walks over to the phone and picks up the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Lisa this is Doctor Mixter at High Hopes Hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Oh, I uh... Hi!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Hello! I'm just calling you to say it was great to meet you today and I'd like to offer you the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lisa is stunned into silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Are you there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... is this a joke or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) No joke, I'd like to offer you the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Absolutely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God I... I can't believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) I'm pleased to welcome you to High Hopes Hospital. If you can be here at 9am tomorrow for an induction please and we'll go from there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God, thank you so much! I really appreciate this, I won't let you down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) I know you won't. We'll see you tomorrow!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, see you tomorrow! Lisa puts the phone down with a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. RECEPTION AREA  HIGH HOPES HOSPITAL - DAY Lisa enters the hospital. A man in his thirties dressed in a boiler suit is stood on a step ladder. He is attempting to change a light bulb in the hallway but seems to be making hard work of it. The bulb drops from his hand and smashes to the ground. Lisa looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gswno! Lisa averts her eyes but the man is now aware of her presence. He has a Polish accent but his English is very articulate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm here for an induction into the cleaning job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be Lisa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, that's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor Mixter said you would be coming. I'm Delaney, we'll be working together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh great. Delaney climbs off the step ladder and shakes Lisa's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We work nights so today we'll just show you around, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll clean this up and we'll get to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. STORAGE CUPBOARD  LATER Delaney opens the cupboard door and for a moment he and Lisa are silhouetted in the doorway. Delaney pulls a string hanging near the door and a light comes on. The cupboard is packed with various cleaning products.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the storage cupboard. Everything you will need for each
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . task is here, each shelf is labelled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The most obvious task is hoovering. This is our hoover here, it's straight forward. You'll be surprised that although it's powerful it's very quiet, because we are working when everyone's in bed so obviously we don't want to wake them up! It has a Telescopic suction tube and six stage filter system. So a lot more powerful than you may be used to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mop and bucket is here, we usually use standard bleach to mix with the water so that's straight forward. But there is this specialist stain remover that you must use if there are any stains on the floor or carpet. It needs to be sprayed and left to set for twenty minutes before scrubbing or mopping. It's a special formula for tea, coffee, water marks and other yellow and brown discolourations on the carpets or floors. It's pretty strong so wash your hands after you use it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the worst parts of the job is we have to remove chewing gum from lots of surfaces. They don't just stick it underneath the tables, it ends up everywhere!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gross!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! I think a lot of the time it's the staff doing it, not the patients! But we have this GumCart, which is a bit complicated but it's easier than just scraping the gum. The steam is super heated to one hundred eighty degrees and delivered at seven point zero bar pressure. It can produce a hundred and fifteen litres of superheated steam per minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it okay if I watch you use it a few times first so I know exactly what I'm doing? I don't want to end up burning myself or any furniture! Delaney smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No problem. Now here we come to the most dangerous chemical we have. This is a concrete cleaner, very toxic stuff, so you have to wear the face mask and gloves we have here, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is for cleaning and descaling brick, stone and concrete and for metal de-rusting. For concrete you must mix it one part to four parts water. Brush or spray it on with the equipment here then leave it five to ten minutes to set, then rinse it off. But for those stubborn son-of-a-bitch marks use it neat!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry if anything seems complicated, you'll get used to it. But you'll mostly be mopping and hoovering in your first few weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah that's fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. WARD B  LATER Lisa follows Delaney into the communal area of Ward B. The walls are white and clinical. Various patients are scattered across the room, each with a look of resignation in their eyes. Many stare blankly out of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Ward B, one of two wards you'll be responsible for cleaning each evening. Essentially the main duties will be emptying the bins, hoovering the carpeted areas and mopping the hallways. The patients in here are Category B. They're mainly people who have had nervous breakdowns and those who are catatonic. They're harmless. Like Missus Hardesty here. Delaney and Lisa walk over to an old woman who is sat still in the chair. Her eyes are open yet she appears lifeless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello Missus Hardesty. No response or acknowledgement of other people's presence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hasn't spoken a word in all her time here. The orderlies just lift her from the bedroom to the day room and back again every day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you just talk to her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've still got to treat them like human beings. Otherwise they just become like furniture and we all lose our humanity. I like to think she can hear me, even if she won't talk to me. See you later Missus Hardesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Missus Hardesty continues to stare into nothingness. Delaney and Lisa exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  CONTINUOUS Delaney and Lisa stroll down the long corridors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The patients are locked in their rooms on our night shift, but now and again they might have an accident we gotta clean up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the day time there are nurses who often clean up but in the night we may be called to provide fresh linen or mop up. Not the most pleasant of jobs but it happens from time to time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah I understand. Delaney and Lisa arrive at a doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now here we come to the most difficult part of the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cleaning crap up isn't the most difficult part?! Delaney smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no, that's very easy compared to what's behind this door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's behind it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This leads down to Ward X.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds ominous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could say that. It's where Category A patients are held. The criminally insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Doctor Mixter didn't mention that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, well, these patients are beyond help so they've become athe hospital's secret. Many of them were transferred from prisons and other institutions. Doctor Mixter probably thought he could help them. He can't. The staff call this place Blood Row. Delaney opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. STAIRCASE  CONTINUOUS Lisa follows Delaney down a winding staircase. As they descend down the steps, the light fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. WARD X  CONTINUOUS Delaney and Lisa enter a long dark corridor with a row of thick metal doors either side. Two light bulbs hang from the ceiling at each end of the corridor, providing only minimal illumination. Lisa's nose twitches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that smell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It always hangs in the air. No matter how much we bleach the floor there is always that smell of death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa looks concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These patients are dangerous?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. But don't worry, we never have to interact directly or anything like that. You will just be mopping the corridor and dusting. Delaney walks over to the first door on the right. There is a hatch on the door. Delaney slowly slides it open and beckons Lisa over. She peers inside. The cell is very basic, white walls with the only furniture being an uncomfortable looking bed and a toilet without a seat. There are thick iron bars on one small window. A skinny man in his thirties sits on a basic bed in a white vest, rocking back and forth. He has wild hair and a scraggly beard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Jerry Kimble. He was convicted of stabbing a young mother forty-nine times in front of her two year-old son, then killing and sexually assaulting a woman before smothering her four-year-old daughter. They call him the Green Chain Rapist. He was in Sing Sing but was certified insane and his lawyer got him transferred here. He doesn't make any noise or fuss, but he is a dangerous man. Especially towards women. This next inmate is even worse. Delaney slides the hatch shut and walks over to the next door. He slowly slides open the hatch and Lisa peers inside. Another basic white cell with only a bed and toilet. A man stands in the centre of the room with his hands behind his back. His hair is slicked back, as jet black as the eyes that stare at Lisa. He smiles. Delaney slides the hatch shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Dennis Palmer. Also known as The Long Island Cannibal. He was abused as a child so his targets were always paedophiles and rapists. He'd track them down and torture them. He would eat parts of their body while they were still alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's horrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The most horrible thing is that a lot of the public thought he was a hero. Delaney walks over to a door on the opposite side of the hallway. He slides open the hatch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sadie Krenwinkel. Lisa looks inside. Inside the basic cell a woman sits cross legged on her bed. She has long flowing black hair, intense eyes and a pentagram carved into her forehead. She looks up and smiles at Lisa. Delaney slides the hatch shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's her deal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was a member of a Witchcraft cult. They kidnapped six people for a demonic ritual. Five were killed but one got away and led police to the cult. She turned her trial into a circus, talking about lots of crazy stuff. The media enjoyed it but she got certified insane by the court. She's been around a few institutions since. Now she's here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some strange stories here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well those aren't the strangest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This last patient is the strangest case. Delaney walks over to the last door on the left. He slides open the hatch. A singular shaft of light coming from a tiny barred window barely penetrates the darkness of the cell. Lisa peers inside to see a man sat in the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is our resident John Doe. Sometimes we have people with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: amnesia. Often we find out who they are. Not so with this man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is he down here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They first brought him in about six months ago. No one knows where he came from, he literally just turned up late one night. An orderly found him wandering the grounds. First of all he was like Missus Hardesty upstairs-catatonic. Then a few weeks later he started to respond to Doctor Mixter and the nurses through facial expressions and gestures. But soon, he got violent. Very violent. He'd have bursts of rage and beat other patients. One day he appeared to have a seizure and collapsed. A young doctor tried to take his vital signs. Patient X here throttled him so hard he crushed his larynx. It took six orderlies to restrain him. Now they won't even let him out for the obligatory hour a day exercise. We still don't know who he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God. Delaney stares at Lisa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God has nothing to do with this man. Delaney slams the hatch shut. Lisa looks disturbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not bad. I ran into a young girl in the hallway earlier. Sweet little girl, she was only about twelve or thirteen. I told her to go back to bed. I guess they don't lock the kids in at night huh? Delaney appears confused.

Lisa pulls the full bag out and ties it up before replacing it with a new bag. With her task complete, Lisa's curiosity gets the better of her. She looks around the office. There is a shelf full of psychology books and a filing cabinet. Lisa touches the top drawer of the filing cabinet and it opens. Lisa looks at all of the names on the files and finds one marked 'Patient X'. She reaches for it and suddenly a HAND grabs her shoulder! A startled Lisa turns around. An orderly in his thirties is stood in front of her. He is thin but muscular, with slicked back hair. This is PEMBERTON.

direction.raw_text: Pemberton!

direction.raw_text: No problem. Lisa, come with me, we've got a job up on Ward B. A grateful Lisa brushes past Pemberton and exits the room. Delaney glares at Pemberton for a moment before leaving the room. Pemberton smirks.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, it gets to everyone at first. But the last thing I want is for you to dread coming to work. Delaney puts his hand on Lisa's shoulder in a comforting manner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. I really appreciate that. Delaney smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .TIME LAPSE: Passage from night to day and back again.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WARD X HIGH HOPES HOSPITAL NIGHT

direction.raw_text: .INT. WARD X  HIGH HOPES HOSPITAL  NIGHT Continual thumping on one of the cell doors echoes around Ward X. Pemberton enters and walks over to Palmer' cell. He slides open the hatch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's with all the fucking racket Palmer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to bother you Mister Pemberton. But I wondered if it would be possible to get some medical attention? Palmer holds up his arm and it's been slashed open. Blood pours from the wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now how the hell did that happen? Palmer holds up a makeshift knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe it was this rather crude weapon that did the damage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ Palmer! Now put the weapon on the floor and back away. Palmer obliges with a smile on his face. Pemberton unhooks a truncheon from his waist belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put your hands on your fucking head and face the wall! Now!! Palmer willingly follows the instructions. Pemberton takes a set of keys from his belt and unlocks the cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm coming in dipshit, one fucking move from you and I'll cave your fucking skull in! You understand??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you wish Mister Pemberton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. PALMER'S CELL  CONTINUOUS Pemberton walks in with the truncheon raised above his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you fucking move!! A nervous Pemberton fumbles at his belt, trying to unhook a pair of handcuffs. Palmer slowly starts to back into him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said don't fucking move! Palmer moves faster. Pemberton swings for him but Palmer ducks it and spins around, pushing Pemberton into the wall knocking him to the floor. Palmer aims a swift and savage stamp at Pemberton's head. His skull crushes against the cold hard floor. Blood spatters all over the white cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm terribly sorry about this. Palmer reaches down, takes Pemberton's keys and exits the cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .EXT. WARD X  CONTINUOUS Palmer stands at the entrance to Kimble's cell. He selects the key marked with the corresponding cell number. Palmer puts it into the keyhole and opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good evening Mister Kimble
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  SAME TIME Hardcastle strolls down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. STAIRCASE  CONTINUOUS Hardcastle looks down to the base of the staircase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pemberton? Pemberton, what's taking you so long man?? No response. Hardcastle rushes down the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. WARD X  CONTINUOUS Hardcastle enters. He sees the door of Palmer' cell open and slams a large red button on the wall next to the entrance. Hardcastle takes out his truncheon and cautiously approaches Palmer' cell. Looking inside he sees Pemberton crumpled on the floor in a pool of his own blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: emerges from the next cell. Hardcastle rushes over to Kimble's cell door. Five orderlies rush onto the Ward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got a major code six over here! The orderlies rush to Hardcastle's side, truncheons at the ready. Hardcastle puts a key in the lock and prepares to open Kimble's cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay alert! Hardcastle turns the key and kicks open the door. They are met by the sight of KIMBLE's corpse positioned upright on the toilet. There is a hole in his head with part of his
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: seeping out. Palmer stands next to him, with blood on his lips and a plastic spoon in his hand. He smiles, blood covering his teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good evening gentleman. I believe we will be one short at roll call tomorrow morning. Hardcastle and the orderlies charge Palmer. He doesn't resist as they viscously tackle him to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  HIGH HOPES HOSPITAL  LATER Lisa is walking down the hallway. She hears a SCREAM emerge from one of the rooms. She puts her ear to the door and hears the SCREAM again. Lisa kneels down and peers through the keyhole. In a clinical white room Palmer is strapped down on a table. His face is severely cut and bruised but he is conscious. Four orderlies hold his arms and legs while a fifth smears conductor on Palmer temples.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we need to put the bit in his mouth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We're not giving him the methohexital either. The orderly places electrodes either side of Palmer' head. He then turns the dial on the ECT device up to full power. Palmer SCREAMS as he violently convulses, salivating heavily from his mouth. Suddenly the saliva turns to blood as he bites his own tongue off. Lisa is horrified as she watches the orderlies laugh as Palmer experiences a severe seizure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shot: Someone is approaching Lisa as she crouches in front of the door. A hand reaches out and GRABS her by the hair,YANKING her to her feet. Lisa SCREAMS. She turns to see Hardcastle standing in front of her. He invades her personal space in an intimidating manner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck are you doing??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just heard something so I ... I was just curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you seeing in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh nothing, I didn't see anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You make sure it stays that way. That guy is a fucking menace and he deserves everything he gets. So you don't talk to Mixter or anyone else about anything you've seen in there. You understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Now don't you got some cleaning to do somewhere?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. Lisa walks down the hallway. Hardcastle's eyes burn into the back of her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .EXT. COFFEE SHOP  LONG ISLAND  DAY Lisa rushes towards the entrance. She's running late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. COFFEE SHOP  CONTINUOUS Lisa rushes inside, nearly knocking someone's coffee out of their hand in the process. She looks across the busy coffee shop and there's an attractive young blonde girl waving at her. NANCY. Lisa rushes to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry I'm running late Nanc!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it, have a seat. A latte yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good, I've ordered it. They'll bring it over soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Lisa looks pale. Black bags under her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God hun, you look like shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh thanks!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, I didn't mean to be blunt but you do. The night shifts getting to ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whole job's getting to me. My body clock's all out of whack but it's not just that. There's something seriously wrong with that place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? A waitress brings over the Latte and places it in front of Lisa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Lisa proceeds to put four sugars in her coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow, you like a little coffee with your sugar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figure it'll wake me up a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's wrong with the place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lot of things. The way they run things for starters, the orderlies are complete bastards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They usually are in those places.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of the patients are extremely violent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't been hurt by anyone have you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, nothing like that. Some of the things they say though... it's pretty frightening. The weirdest thing is... Oh I dunno, maybe it's just me. I wonder if I'm seeing things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think the place might be haunted. Either that or I'm losing my mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I wouldn't be surprised if it was haunted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told my father about your new job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, y'know they only built that Asylum a couple of years ago?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says it was built on the site of One Twelve Ocean Avenue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never heard of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a famous house. Or should I say infamous. Some guy shot his whole family there back in the seventies. Parents, brothers, sisters. Wiped out his entire family with a shotgun. Then the next owners of the house only lasted there about a month. They said they were driven from the house by evil spirits. The house became known around the world. That's why the recent owners sold the land, they had enough of all the media interest and constant tourists. Have you seriously never heard of the Amityville horror house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I vaguely remember hearing some stuff a while ago, but I never really took it in. I honestly didn't realise that the hospital was on the same land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup, right on the spot where the house was demolished. You really think the place is haunted?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either that or I'm going crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well you're not crazy, hun. Perhaps the stories about hauntings at the house were true. Maybe the house is gone but the spirits stuck around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You believe in ghosts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno, never seen one. But I like to think I'm open minded. Plus you're the most intelligent girl I know. If you say you've seen something, I believe you. Lisa smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks Nanc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what are you gonna do? Are you gonna quit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Part of me says I should. There's a lot about the place that frightens me. But I dunno... I think I've seen too much to be able to just walk away and forget the place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I was you I'd just walk away. Who wants to work at a place that frightens them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I need the money for starters. But now it feels like I need to find out more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you are crazy after all!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. BEDROOM  LISA'S HOME  DAY Lisa is sitting on her bed studying a laptop. On screen she
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Ronald Joseph "Butch" DeFeo, Jr. is an American mass murderer. He was tried and convicted for the 1974 killings of his father, mother, two brothers and two sisters." We slowly push in on Lisa's eyes and then:

direction.raw_text: .EXT. 112 OCEAN AVENUE  DAY  1974 RONALD DEFEO SENIOR is in the garden of his home chopping firewood with a large axe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appears: November 1974.

direction.raw_text: dissolves.

direction.raw_text: approaches him.

direction.raw_text: Hey Pop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You come to help?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again? Boy, you better not be turning up for work tomorrow like a goddamn zombie again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, yeah Pop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't yeah yeah me boy. You're on a last warning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I seen you got Mark a wheelchair. Mom says it cost five hundred bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well how come you're spending five hundred bucks on Mark and I gotta come beg you for money all the time huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter with you, boy? Your brother's broken his leg, he needs that wheelchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I need money too!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Butch, you get a wage from the auto dealership every Friday and it's gone by Monday. Why is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you spending that money on huh? Cos it ain't rent or food. You get everything you want for nothing 'round here. I know what you're really doing with that money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, you better shut that mouth of yours. Ronald Senior stands there, axe in hand, eye-balling his son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This ain't over. Butch storms back towards the house. Ronald Senior brings the axe forcefully down on a piece of wood, splitting it cleanly in half.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. APARTMENT  AMITYVILLE  DAY There is a knock on the door. A pale looking man in his twenties opens the door to reveal Butch standing in the door way holding a brown paper bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Mick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Butch, I told you man, you can't get no shit on lay-away any more. Your credit's all used up. Butch pulls a wad of money out of the paper bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You accept cash? Mick smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My man! Come on in.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: LIVING ROOM APARTMENT A LITTLE LATER

direction.raw_text: .INT. LIVING ROOM  APARTMENT  A LITTLE LATER Butch uses a lighter to boil a spoon full of heroin. On his right arm is a belt. He then loads the heroin into a syringe. Butch tightens the belt and taps his arm. He sinks the needle into a prominent vein and plunges the heroin into his blood stream. His eyes sink and he lies back onto the crusty carpet of the apartment, staring up at the ceiling. From a bird's eye view we slowly move down towards Butch. Suddenly a chorus of voices chatter around his ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 (O.S) It's kill or be killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 (O.S) Why haven't you killed that pig?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #3 (O.S) They are plotting against you. We have decided that you must take action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #4 (O.S) Kill them. Kill them all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  112 OCEAN AVENUE  DAY Butch puts his jacket on and prepares to open the front door. Suddenly a large hand GRABS the back of his jacket. Butch swipes the hand away and spins around to see his father red with rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nineteen thousand dollars boy! Nineteen thousand!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stole that fuckin' money from the auto dealership!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck you talking about?? I was robbed!! Didn't Brigante tell you huh? Some fuckers car jacked me Pop. I told the police about it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You expect me to believe that, boy? You think I'm fuckin' stupid??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't saying your stupid pop, I'm telling you the truth! I was robbed god-damn it! Ronald Senior grabs Butch by the scruff of the neck and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: him against the door. LOUISE DEFEO rushes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's going on??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our son's a fuckin' junkie thief, that's what's going on!! He robbed the fucking dealership!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't listen to him Ma, I ain't done nothing!! Ronald Senior and Butch fall to the floor and start grappling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it!! Stop it now!! Louise attempts to pull Ronald Senior off Butch. Her nails dig into her husband's neck and draw blood. An enraged Ronald Senior grabs his wife's arms as she starts to slap him. Butch scrambles to his feet and rushes down the hallway. Ronald Senior remonstrates with Louise who is still trying to slap him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you always have to get involved huh?? You've always been too soft on that boy!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you touch him!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He needs some fuckin' discipline!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay away from him!! Suddenly Ronald Senior feels cold metal pressed against the back of his head. Louise SCREAMS and steps back. Ronald Senior freezes. Ronald Senior slowly turns to see Butch, his eyes bloodshot and his face emotionless, aiming a MARLIN RIFLE at his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've had enough of you fat man!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie, don't!! Please!! Ronald Senior's trembles with fear as he stares into his son's cold eyes. Butch places his finger on the trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!! Butch pulls the trigger. Louise SCREAMS. The gun JAMS. Ronald Senior breathes a sigh of relief. Butch lowers the gun and storms off towards the basement. Louise embraces Ronald Senior, who appears to be in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. LANDING  112 OCEAN AVENUE  LATER Butch is quietly stalking the landing. He can hear whispers from his parents' bedroom and cranes his neck to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) I want him out of this house tomorrow. He's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) I guess you're right. He's twenty three now, he just doesn't belong here any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) His age ain't the problem Louise, those goddamn drugs he's taking are. I'm not having that going on under my roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) We'll talk to him tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S) The time has come. And it's long over due. Ronald stands upright. Behind him is a FIGURE in a black robe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill them before they kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S ring out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. BEDROOM  LISA'S HOME  DAY Lisa scans down the web page and looks at photos of Butch DeFeo and his family. Suddenly she reaches a picture of 13 year old Allison and her blood runs cold. She recognises Allison as the little girl she encountered in the hospital hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  HIGH HOPES HOSPITAL  NIGHT Lisa and Delaney are sat on a bench in the hallway drinking coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know the history of this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's not much history. We've only been open a couple of years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I mean the history of the land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean... what was on the land before the hospital?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know a bit about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One Twelve Ocean Avenue. The Amityville haunted house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I don't know that it was haunted. Lots of people think that's lies. I know about the kid that killed his family. That's true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know about it until a friend told me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? It's a famous case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come you never mentioned it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seem spooked already. I didn't want to make it worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know why I'm spooked?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because of the patients on Ward X.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not just that Delaney. I think this place is haunted. In fact, I'm sure of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've seen something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember I said I saw a little girl roaming the hallways here? I know who she is. She's one of the DeFeo children who were killed. You ever seen her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honestly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To be honest I don't believe in all that ghost stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I wasn't a huge believer, but I know what I've seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe that you've seen something. Some people are more open to that kind of thing, y'know? But me? I'm closed off to that extra terrestrial stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Extra terrestrial is aliens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever it's called, I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what do you believe in? Do you believe in God?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Serious questions tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you ask?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's something I've been thinking about. How can evil exist in a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . world that many people believe was created by a loving God?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe that God is a bearded man who lives in the sky. Or that the Devil is a red demon with horns. I believe God and Satan are within all of us. God is our human side. Satan is our animal side. Whether we become good or evil depends which side of us we feed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a frightening thing to believe that if God exists he is not powerful enough to stop evil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Free will in the hands of a person who feeds the Evil inside them. That's what frightens me. Lisa ponders for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor Mixter must have known what stood on this land before the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course he did. He bought the land and organised the demolition of the house himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would he build on this land knowing the history of the place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not superstitious. He's a doctor, they don't usually believe in those things. Amityville is full of local legends, going back even before the DeFeos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's stories about the Native Americans being slaughtered on this land many years ago. Some people
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: even believed the Indian Chief possessed that kid who killed his family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think that's true. If I've learnt anything from the patients on Ward X, it's that some people have a mind that works in a different way to other people. Those people who do bad things have fed the evil within them more than the good. It's not possession, it's sickness. Sickness of the soul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what to think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just don't let your imagination run away with you Lisa. You're a person who feeds that good within you. Don't let this place feed the evil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. LIBRARY  AMITYVILLE  DAY Lisa enters the Library. She approaches a stuffy looking middle aged woman with glasses perched on the end of her nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, sorry to bother you but my name's Lisa Templeton. I rang yesterday to set up a meeting with Gloria Branco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, that's me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh great! Thank you for agreeing to meet with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No problem, nice to meet you! I've set up a table in the back. I've
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . got a few books that may help you with your inquiries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, that's great. Lisa follows Gloria to the back of the Library.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. LIBRARY  LATER Lisa and Gloria are sat at a table in a secluded corner of the Library. Various books are spread out on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you wanted to know about the history of Amityville dating back to the Native Americans?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes that's right. I'm writing a college paper and I had heard some rumours in the neighbourhood about Native Americans being killed on the land down on Oceans Avenue. Gloria's demeanour instantly turns from jovial to serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that area has quite a dark history.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean the DeFeo murders at One Twelve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Terrible business that. Those young children. Breaks my heart to think about such a tragedy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah it's awful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know most of the town was very upset when they decided to build that mental institution on the land. That used to be a nice suburban neighbourhood, now there's this big eye sore there. We had a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: thousand names on a petition. But I guess that Doctor who runs the place has enough money to pay off the people in high places.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what about the native Americans? Is that story about them being killed on that land true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something on that here. Gloria flips through one of the books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah yes, here it is. (Reading) In the 18th Century there existed a group of Native Americans in Amityville known as "The Satchem Tribe" led by Satchem Takapausha, the Chief. The tribe had fled Salem in Massachusetts to escape persecution by the Christians who were persecuting members of the tribe because of their Witchcraft practices. These practices included a ritualistic human sacrifice of six people (The significance of Six being related to the biblical number of man and creation) in order to induce the spirit of their God, The Dark Master, who they believed manifested his powers through his devoted followers, giving them immortality. The hundred strong tribe settled in Amityville but were later chased off the land by local Christians. Satchem accused the Christians of not properly compensating his tribe for the land. A war started and the Christians hired a hunter called John Underhill from Salem. At the site where One Twelve Oceans Avenue was later built in Amityville, Underhill killed all of the tribe. The Indians were buried in a mass grave on the site. Before he died Satchem vowed revenge. According to local legend, Chief Satchem is believed to have subsequently haunted the land. Various parapsychologists and mediums have
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . claimed that Satchem's vengeful spirit influenced the 1974 DeFeo murders at One Twelve Oceans Avenue and the haunting of the subsequent owners. Although such assertions are widely disputed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So the legend has basis in historical fact?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. STAFF ROOM  HIGH HOPES HOSPITAL  NIGHT Lisa is sat with Delaney, both nursing a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told me the other night that you think evil is within us all. But do you think that people can be influenced by an evil that comes from outside of themselves?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you still thinking about this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I am yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I worry that you're thinking too much. This place is getting to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something going on in this place. Something sinister. And I don't just mean the patients on Ward X. Have you not noticed that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've noticed some things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why haven't you said anything? Or done anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delaney contemplates for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like the honey bee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The honey bee is fine when it's just flying from flower to flower. Then they think that a person is a threat and they sting them. They might leave a sting but the person will recover. The bee dies. So I ask myself... is it worth it? Delaney returns his attention to the cup of coffee in his hands as Lisa disappears into her own thoughts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. LIVING ROOM  LISA'S HOME  DAY Lisa is sat in an armchair with a laptop resting on her thighs. On screen she is reading a Wikipedia entry: "The Satchem Tribe was a tribe of Native American origin that existed in the 18th Century. They fled Massachusetts and settled in Amityville where they were ultimately murdered over a land dispute. The Tribe was renowned for practices in line with Witchcraft and worshipped a God called The Dark Master. In 2009, it emerged that a modern cult incarnation of the tribe existed. They have adopted the traditional beliefs of the Satchem tribe but the modern followers are not required to be of Native American origin." Lisa scrolls down to the References section. She clicks on a link. A Blog appears on screen entitled The Dark Master: An Ancient Vision for A Modern World. She reads the latest Blog
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Our time is at hand. On November 13th 2013, 6 souls will be sacrificed so that The Dark Master's devoted followers may be blessed with immortality. As non-believers perish on doomsday the Master's loyal subjects shall live on and be bestowed with great power and responsibility for the direction of the New World."Lisa opens up the Calendar on her computer. November 13th is the day after tomorrow. Lisa refers back to the blog and notices the author of the last blog post: "SisterSadie".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lisa's mind is racing. Lisa types 'Sadie Krenwinkel' into a Search Engine. The first result is a Wikipedia entry. Lisa clicks on it. She reads: "Sadie Krenwinkel is a convicted murderer and former member of The Satchem Cult, a modern incarnation of a Native American tribe who practiced Witchcraft in the 18th Century. In 2009, Krenwinkel led ten members of the cult to 1005 Dennison Drive where they subsequently tortured and murdered five individuals. One potential victim managed to escape and lead police to Krenwinkel. At her trial in 2010, Krenwinkel outlined the beliefs of the Satchem Cult, claiming the human sacrifice of six individuals would have given them immortality. As a result her lawyer submitted a plea of insanity and Krenwinkel was subsequently sentenced to indefinite incarceration in a mental institution." Lisa reads further down the page and notices that the name of the Doctor who testified to her insanity at her trial:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .EXT. HIGH HOPES HOSPITAL  DAY Lisa rushes towards the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. WARD X  DAY Lisa enters Ward X. She walks down the hallway and bangs on Sadie's cell door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what you're doing. No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've seen that blog. How are you getting access to the internet? Lisa slides open the hatch and looks inside. The cell is covered in lit candles with Sadie sat cross legged in the centre of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you allowed to have all this stuff in your cell huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Dark Master is near. It's too late to stop it now. Tonight will behold a great becoming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going to happen? You're planning on a human sacrifice aren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All good things to those who wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me!! Sadie stares directly at Lisa with intense eyes. An unnaturally deep voice escapes her lips:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our time is at hand! Lisa slides the hatch shut. She walks over to the last door on the left. Lisa slides the hatch open and peers in. The resident John Doe sits in the shadows. Suddenly he sits forward and a bright shaft of daylight illuminates his face. Lisa is shocked to see a face she recognises from the internet article staring at her. The face of RONALD "BUTCH" DEFEO JUNIOUR. Lisa slams the hatch shut and backs down the hallway, her mind racing as fast as her pulse rate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. HALLWAY  LATER Lisa knocks on the door to Doctor's Mixter's office.

direction.raw_text: (O.S) Come in. Lisa pops her head inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor Mixter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Lisa, Hello. What brings you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just wondered if I could speak to you for a moment sir. It's very important.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. MIXTER'S OFFICE  CONTINUOUS Lisa enters and sits down opposite Mixter, who is sat behind his desk filling out a form.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do for you Lisa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... what I'm going to tell you will sound really strange but I need to tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know the history of the land the hospital is built on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you referring to exactly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, first of all. The DeFeo murders and the infamous house that people said was haunted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am aware of the DeFeo murders yes. The hauntings... well I think it's common perception now that a lot of that was exaggerated by the media.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe. Are you aware of the history of the land dating back to the eighteenth century?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I can't say that I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There were a group of Native Americans in Amityville known as "The Satchem Tribe". They were massacred by Christians after a dispute over the land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. I'm sure there's a point to all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Sadie Krenwinkel down on Ward X. She shares the beliefs of the Satchem Tribe. I have reason to believe that somehow she has access to the internet and Witchcraft paraphernalia and she's planning on a human sacrifice tonight to try and raise the God she believes in, The Dark Master, and become immortal. Mixter chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you been reading up on Sadie? It's rather outlandish stuff isn't it? But I can assure you she has no access to the internet or anything else.

direction.raw_text: Well that could be anyone called Sadie couldn't it?

direction.raw_text: Go down and search her cell!

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then someone is helping her get access to this stuff! Someone who works here! Please Doctor Mixter. Just check out her cell and speak to her. direction.raw_text: Yes I did. What are you implying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. I just meant you know how dangerous she is.

direction.raw_text: Yes, I understand how dangerous she is and I appreciate you coming to express your concerns. One thing you need to bear in mind Lisa is that there are some very sick patients at this institution. We do our best to help those who can be helped but unfortunately the patients on Ward X are beyond help. Their personality disorders are too advanced, their delusions are too grandiose. I worry that perhaps you have been rather taken in by one of those delusions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that it might sound like that. But can you check her cell and speak to her? Look at the blog on the internet, see if you can connect the IP number of the writer with a computer here at the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay look. That does take time and resources I don't necessarily have. But as you've come to me with a concern of patient infraction and potential threat of violence, I am duty bound to investigate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In fact, I'll order a cell search immediately. Stay here for a moment, I'll be right back. Mixter exits. Lisa leans forward and a file on the desk catches her eye. She stands up and reaches over for it. Her
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is on it. Lisa opens it up. Inside is a form Committing her to the hospital as a PATIENT. Lisa looks down and the reason stated is PARANOID DELUSION. The date on the form is November 13th. Today. Lisa slams the file shut and the office door opens. She turns to see Mixter stood there with Hardcastle and another orderly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doing??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is for your own good Lisa. You need treatment. The orderlies approach her. Lisa lashes out but the two men overpower her, grabbing her arms and then tripping her. She hits the floor with a thud. Mixter produces a syringe from behind his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is for your own good Lisa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you!!! Mixter plunges the needle into her neck. POV SHOT: Lisa looks up at Mixter and the orderlies and we FADE TO BLACK.

direction.raw_text: .INT. CELL  NIGHT Lisa awakens, sat in the corner of a cold white cell. She tries to get up before realising she's strapped into a straight jacket. Lisa SCREAMS. The hatch opens and Mixter peers in. The hatch then closes and the door opens. Mixter enters.

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid not my dear. You've always been with us here. Initially as an out patient but now the delusions have progressed I feel it's time for you to become a full time resident.

direction.raw_text: Lisa becomes upset. Tears stream down her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But... but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I understand it's a lot to process now. I'll leave you to think about it and then we'll begin counselling sessions tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Lisa sobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, how about I take this straight jacket off so you're more comfortable?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First you must take this. It will help you sleep. Mixter hands Lisa a red pill and a bottle of water. She takes the pill and pops it in her mouth before taking a gulp of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good girl. I know it's a lot to take in but together we'll get through this. Now I'm going to take your restraint off. Remember though, if you're violent then I promise you it will go straight back on. Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Mixter unties the straight jacket at the back and lifts it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That better?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No problem. I'm going to leave you get some rest now. Tomorrow we start the healing process. Mixter exits. The echo of the steel door closing reverberates around the tiny cell. We hear Mixter's footsteps as he walks down the hallway. Lisa's upset demeanour disappears immediately. She spits the red pill into the palm of her hand.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about if I blow your fucking head off then huh?? Suddenly SIRENS can be heard outside. The screeching of car wheels. Mixter smiles. Lisa, still holding the gun at Mixter, shuffles over to the window and peers through the blinds. The car park is full of police cars. A dozen armed police officers rush towards the building. Lisa looks back to see Mixter chuckling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck are you laughing at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all falling into place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cops coming here? I'm gonna tell them everything about you and your little sick plan! They're gonna lock you up and throw away the key!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you say so. Outside they hear the police rushing down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me something Lisa, would it help your grief over your mother if you knew she was a slut?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. That's why she's burning in hell. Lisa, her teeth clenched, moves forward and places the business end of the rifle against Mixter's temple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shut the fuck about my mother, you don't know anything!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that sometimes you wonder why you don't cry enough for her. I know you feel guilty for not doing more for her when she was alive. You feel guilty for moving on with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . your life and forgetting about her!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have not forgotten about her!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Face it Lisa, you never cared for her. You never cared for anyone but yourself. She's looking up from the bowels of hell now knowing that you never loved her! Tears stream down Lisa's face. She's crumbling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! SHUT UP!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was a whore! Lisa HITS Mixter over the head with the butt of the rifle. He falls to the ground and looks up at a crazed Lisa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother's in hell and you don't care!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you!! Lisa aims the rifle at Mixter's face. Suddenly the police burst in. Lisa spins around, the rifle still in her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Her body is riddled with BULLETS and she falls to the floor in a blood soaked heap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: against BLACK SCREEN appears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dissolves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .INT. TELEVISION STUDIO A glamorous woman addresses the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we're back with our next guest. A year ago he was a survivor of the High Hopes Hospital mass murder when cleaner Lisa Templeton ran amok with a rifle, claiming six victims and injuring many others. Doctor Elliot Mixter has written a new book entitled 'Shattered Hopes' which provides an account of that fateful night as well as some background into the mind of the murderer. Doctor Mixter, good morning. Mixter is sat opposite, in a very expensive suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning Katherine, how are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm good thank you. So Doctor, can you tell us a little more about the book?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it features a blow by blow account of the evening. It was obviously a very harrowing experience and for me it was rather therapeutic to deal with my feelings about what happened in writing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How has it affected the hospital Doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously we were all left very numb by events for a long time and I know a lot of people in the town felt we should close the institution. But that never occurred to me. I feel that people should be brought closer by tragedy and the Staff and I have definitely become closer, both as colleagues and friends, since the incident. That bond makes for a better
direction.name: direction
